author: sina.com.cn
title: 智能电动车ETF（516380）跌0.79%，成交额79.64万元|ETF_新浪财经_新浪网
text:
6月12日，华宝智能电动汽车ETF（516380）收盘跌0.79%，成交额79.64万元。
智能电动车ETF（516380）成立于2021年6月4日，基金全称为华宝中证智能电动汽车交易型开放式指数证券投资基金，基金简称为华宝智能电动汽车ETF。该基金管理费率每年0.50%，托管费率每年0.10%。智能电动车ETF（516380）业绩比较基准为中证智能电动汽车指数收益率。
规模方面，截止6月11日，智能电动车ETF（516380）最新份额为1.22亿份，最新规模为9248.60万元。回顾2024年12月31日，智能电动车ETF（516380）份额为1.40亿份，规模为1.04亿元。即该基金今年以来份额减少12.82%，规模减少11.09%。
流动性方面，截止6月12日，智能电动车ETF（516380）近20个交易日累计成交金额1731.13万元，日均成交金额86.56万元；今年以来，105个交易日，累计成交金额1.32亿元，日均成交金额126.10万元。
智能电动车ETF（516380）现任基金经理为陈建华。陈建华自2021年6月4日管理（或拟管理）该基金，任职期内收益-24.49%。
最新定期报告显示，智能电动车ETF（516380）重仓股包括 比亚迪 、 宁德时代 、 立讯精密 、 汇川技术 、 长城汽车 、 韦尔股份 、 三花智控 、 科大讯飞 、 拓普集团 、 亿纬锂能 ，持仓占比如下。 股票代码 股票名称 持仓占比 持仓股数（股） 持仓市值（元） 002594 比亚迪 17.67% 4.62万 1733.91万 300750 宁德时代 13.47% 5.23万 1321.64万 002475 立讯精密 7.77% 18.65万 762.60万 300124 汇川技术 4.80% 6.91万 471.37万 601633 长城汽车 4.27% 16.07万 419.43万 603501 韦尔股份 4.09% 3.03万 401.68万 002050 三花智控 3.04% 10.34万 298.23万 002230 科大讯飞 2.87% 5.92万 281.70万 601689 拓普集团 2.71% 4.60万 265.60万 300014 亿纬锂能 2.57% 5.35万 252.04万

author: antaranews.com
title: Jokowi inaugurates Pamukkulu Dam in South Sulawesi - ANTARA News
text: During Friday's inauguration ceremony, broadcast by his office, he emphasized the importance of water as a vital resource for daily life and agricultural success. Jokowi noted that agricultural production, including rice, has declined globally, potentially leading to famine for 500 million people. "Water has become an essential commodity," he pointed out. The dam, whose construction began in 2017, was completed in nearly seven years. Built at a cost of Rp1.6 trillion (US$95 million), it has a capacity of 82 million cubic meters and an area of inundation reaching 460 hectares. "This is a large and expensive dam," he said. Jokowi explained that rainwater collected through the dam will provide local people with irrigation water, electricity, and flood control. "The primary function is irrigation, supplying water for rice fields in Takalar and surrounding areas," he added. To further boost agricultural productivity in South Sulawesi, the government has distributed 80 water pumps to Bantaeng district, part of a national program aiming to distribute 20,000 pumps. These pumps are expected to support rice field irrigation and agricultural activities, mitigating the drought predicted for July to October. Related news: Jokowi checks installation of 80 water pumps in S Sulawesi's Bantaeng Related news: Nusantara Capital City to boost agricultural demand, says Jokowi Translator: Mentari Dwi G, Resinta Sulistiyandari Editor: Anton Santoso Copyright © ANTARA 2024

author: The Columbus Dispatch Staff
title: Northern lights photos from Central Ohio October 2024
text: I drove out to find as little light pollution as I could, as it turns out Morrow County was the spot. In May, I could kind of make out a little color and haze but last night I could see the movement and the pulsating intensity of the lights.The northern lights, taken at 10p.m., north of Hayden Run Road, west of Route 42.Northern lights illuminate the sky east of Hoover Reservoir on Thursday, Oct. 10, 2024. The auroras were visible for much of the northern United States thanks to a powerful solar storm.Northern lights as seen from a Bethel Road neighborhood.The northern lights from the Golfview Woods neighborhood.Northern Lights over Blendon Woods Metropark in Gahanna.The northern lights seen in Westerville Ohio near Metzger Park.The northern lights, taken from southern Marion County at approximately 11:00 p.m.The northern lights from northeast of Columbus near Johnstown. Check out the stars!The northern lights, taken in Dublin around 10:15 p.m. right as the aurora became clear to the naked eye.The northern lights, looking north on Royalton Rd, near Royalton, Ohio, at approximately 10:10 p.m.The northern lights from Delaware State Park.The northern lights from Delaware State Park.The northern lights, taken outside of Sandusky, OH.The northern lights at 10:15 p.m. in Hilliard.The northern lights above Pickerington.The northern lights from Madison County between Mt. Sterling and London.The northern lights from Clintonville. It was in the sky for about 10 minutes while I was walking my dog. It was so cool that I was able to get this in an urban part of town with so much light pollution.The northern lights from Hilliard.The northern lights from Morrow County.The northern lights from Hoover Dam in Westerville about 9:30 p.m.The northern lights over Lake Erie as viewed from Lakewood Park in Lakewood, Ohio. The celestial phenomena was viewable throughout the state Thursday night, Oct. 10.The northern lights from Morrow County.

author: Márcio Furuno
title: Hortolândia registra saldo positivo de 104 vagas de emprego em junho
text:
Informação foi divulgada pelo Caged do governo federal esta semana; município foi o 2º melhor da região no ranking geral de junho
Hortolândia mantém desempenho positivo na economia ao longo deste ano. O município teve saldo positivo de 104 vagas de emprego criadas em junho. O dado está no levantamento mensal do Caged (Cadastro Geral de Empregados e Desempregados), divulgado pelo governo federal, esta semana. De acordo com o levantamento, empresas da cidade fizeram 2.515 contratações e 2.411 desligamentos durante o período.
A Secretaria de Desenvolvimento Econômico, Trabalho, Turismo e Inovação destaca que Hortolândia ficou em 2º lugar no ranking da região de saldo de vagas de emprego em junho.
Ainda de acordo com a secretaria, o comércio e a indústria foram os setores econômicos que mais contribuíram na criação de vagas de emprego na cidade.
O comércio abriu 146 vagas em junho. Foi o melhor desempenho do setor até agora este ano. Já a indústria abriu 71 vagas de emprego.
“A indústria é um dos três setores fundamentais para o crescimento econômico de Hortolândia. Esse segmento tem mostrado aumento de produção, fato que impacta no bom desempenho da cidade. Outro fator excepcional é a alta tecnologia, que está calibrada com as demandas das empresas. Hortolândia vive o crescimento econômico, mas ajustado à essência do desenvolvimento sustentável”, salienta o secretário de Desenvolvimento Econômico, Trabalho, Turismo e Inovação, Dimas Corrêa Pádua.
Em fevereiro deste ano , Hortolândia registrou o melhor saldo de vagas de emprego desde 2020, quando foi iniciada a série histórica do CAGED. O levantamento apontou que o município teve saldo de 553 vagas, impulsionadas por mulheres e jovens.
FEIRÃO
A Prefeitura de Hortolândia ainda tem feito ações para estimular a abertura demais vagas de emprego. Uma das ações foi a 1ª edição do Feirão de Empregos , realizada em julho deste ano. O município deve realizar outra edição ainda este ano.

author: Leah Nylen, Bloomberg
title: Chamber of Commerce sues to block FTC's noncompete ban
text: Chamber of Commerce sues to block FTC's noncompete ban Business groups led by the U.S. Chamber of Commerce sued the Federal Trade Commission Wednesday seeking to block [a rule finalized this week that would outlaw noncompete provisions](https://www.abajournal.com/syndicated/article/ftc-bans-contracts-that-keep-workers-from-jumping-to-rival-employers) that prohibit workers from switching jobs within an industry. In a complaint filed in Texas federal court, the nation’s largest business lobby argued that the antitrust and consumer protection agency lacks the authority to issue rules that define unfair methods of competition. The FTC Act, which established the agency, allows it to bring cases challenging particular practices, the group said, but not to write rules. The Chamber was joined by Business Roundtable and several Texas business groups in challenging the rule. “The Commission’s categorical ban on virtually all noncompetes amounts to a vast overhaul of the national economy,” the Chamber said in the complaint. The rule “reflects an unlawful and unprecedented exercise of bureaucratic power.” The FTC voted 3-2 along party lines to issue a final rule banning noncompetes in nearly all cases. The agency’s two Republicans dissented, adopting arguments similar to the business group that the FTC lacks clear congressional authority to write rules. Democrats argued that the law explicitly allows the FTC prohibit unfair methods of competition while another provision authorizes the agency “to make rules and regulations for the purpose of carrying out the provisions of” the law. Taken together, those provisions permit the FTC to issue rules defining unfair conduct, they say, citing a 1973 case that upheld the agency’s rulemaking authority.

author: Francis Xavier
title: “The World’s Worst Weather” What Its Like Working At Mount Washington Observatory
text:
“We are collecting a very unique data set crucial to understanding climate change at a unique environment like this. What happens up here is eventually gonna trickle down to the valley.” –Observer Charlie Peachey
We’ve often heard that the summit of New Hampshire’s Mount Washington has the “worst weather on earth” so whats it like to live there? Check out this piece by
News Center Maine as they join the folks at the Mount Washington Observatory to get an idea of what the job entails.
Observers work 8 days with 12 hour shifts on at the highest point in the Northeast and then get 6 days off. While on the clock they monitor data, educate the public and diligently go outside every hour to take measurements often using analog tools as they are more reliable than electronic alternatives.
The conditions are extreme but when indoors observers have a relatively comfortable existence with hearty meals, streaming services and resident cat named Nimbus that oversees operations (Nimbus is believed to the 18th such feline employee).
Shoutout to the observers at Mount Washington and all the weather professionals across the country and the earth who work hard everyday to provide us best possible information. We appreciate you!!!

author: Laurel V Williams
title: Gran Couva woman choked in robbery - Trinidad and Tobago Newsday
text:
News Gran Couva woman choked in robbery Laurel V Williams 2 Hrs Ago Police cars on a crime scene. - File photo by Jeff K Mayers ONE of two men who broke into the apartment of a 47-year-old market vendor from Gran Couva choked her because they were having problems opening a door to get away.
The two suspects managed to open the door and left with a bag containing about $15,000 and jewellery valued at $18,000.
The police said around 9 pm on June 11, the victim locked her burglarproofing, doors and windows and went to sleep on a couch in the living room.
Around 1.45 am, she was awakened by a noise and saw two masked men standing in the living room.
They announced a robbery, ransacked the apartment and took the bag containing the money as well as the jewellery.
They then tried to leave, but struggled to open the door. One of the men choked the victim and demanded that she open it for them, but they then succeeded in doing so.
A report was made to the Gran Couva police station and PCs Khan and Douglas visited and searched for the suspects. No one was arrested.
The men had got into the apartment by breaking the lock on the burglarproofing and opening the main door.
PC Khan is leading the investigation.
